Today 46% of all new income goes to the top 1%. Millions of Americans are forced to work 2 or 3 jobs just to survive. Over half of our people live paycheck to paycheck. And 3 people own as much wealth as the bottom 50%.

We won't accept a rigged economy any longer.
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text:
U.S. participation in the Saudi-led war in Yemen has not been authorized by Congress. It is unconstitutional. And it is contributing to the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

Today the Senate must exercise its power and vote to remove the U.S. from this war in Yemen.
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: It is Congress who decides if and when the U.S. goes to war, not the president. For far too long Congress has abdicated that responsibility. Today that must end. Today the Senate must vote to stop supporting the Saudi-led war in Yemen, where 85,000 children have starved to death.
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: How can we call this a civilized society when some Americans have access to the best medical care in the world and others are unable to walk into a doctor’s office because they lack money?

-Our trade deficit in goods up to record-breaking $891 billion
-$50 billion in government contracts given to outsourcers
-185,000 American jobs shipped overseas on his watch
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: It goes without saying that someone who commits a serious crime must pay their debt to society. But punishment for a crime, or keeping dangerous people behind bars, does not cause people to lose their rights to citizenship. It should not cause them to lose their right to vote. 5/
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: Our present-day crisis of mass incarceration has become a tool of voter suppression. Today, over 4.5 million Americans — disproportionately people of color — have lost their right to vote because they have served time in jail or prison for a felony conviction. 4/
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: After the ratification of the 13th, 14th, and 15th Amendments, which extended civil and legal protections to formerly enslaved people, many state governments rushed to create new felonies to put black people in jail and then institute lifetime disenfranchisement. 3/
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: When we look at the history of why our country has banned incarcerated people from voting, we must understand that the efforts to rob citizens of their voting rights was a legacy of slavery and continuing racist attitudes post-Jim Crow. 2/
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: If we are serious about calling ourselves a democracy, we must firmly establish that the right to vote is an inalienable and universal principle that applies to all American citizens 18 years and older. Period. 1/ https://t.co/d8H6Cntn3Q

Text:

$143 million.

Text:
When Harry Truman first proposed guaranteeing health care to seniors the idea was billed as radical, “un-American” and an attack on basic freedom.

Medicare is now one of the most popular government programs.

We can make health care a right to ALL if we have the political will.
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text:
Senator Nina Turner on Why Universal Health Care, Higher Wages, and Free Public Education Are Crucial Issues for Black Women - ⁦@voguemagazine⁩ 
#NotMeUs #Bernie2020  https://t.co/XdLtnFSzRS
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text:
One of the most heartbreaking things I’ve read in our ER bill database:

A 2-year-old eats a dangerous drug. Poison control tells her mom to take the toddler to the ER immediately.

But the family is already in debt from another ER bill. They can’t afford another one. (1/2)
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text:
Medicare for All will:

-Expand to Medicare to cover all people
-Cover long-term care, dental, vision and hearing aids
-Reduce overall health care spending
-End the situation where Americans must choose between food or medicine

We are going to make health care a human right.
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: In Greenville, South Carolina, and cities all over the country, people can no longer afford to live in the communities where they were born and raised, created memories and built families. We will attack the problem of gentrification and rising rents in America https://t.co/fzfHAyn3yn
Name: Bernie Sanders

Text: "The changes I've fought for and am fighting for still—like Medicare for All, free college tuition and a $15 minimum wage... Text: Uber says it can't pay its drivers more money, but rewarded its CEO with nearly $50 million last year. People who work for multibillion-dollar companies should not have to work 70 or 80 hours a week to get by. I stand with the Uber and Lyft drivers going on strike on May 8.

#BernieAtWalmart
